title: Which element has the atomic number 26? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fe iron (ferrite)Atomic number (Z)	26Group, block	group 8, d-blockPeriod	period 4Element category	: transition metalStandard atomic weight (Ar)	55.845(2)[1]Electron configuration	[Ar] 3d6 4s2Electrons per shell2, 8, 14, 2 In human blood it act as haemoglobin for growth of harmones and essential body parts..

Iron is a chemical element with symbol Fe and atomic number 26. Here are some more details that might help you :- Atomic Mass: 55.845 amu Melting Point: 1535.0 °C (1808.15 K, 2795.0 °F) Boiling Point: 2750.0 °C (3023.15 K, 4982.0 °F)Number of Protons/Electrons: 26 Number of Neutrons: 30 Classification: Transition Metal Crystal Structure: Cubic Density at 293 K: 7.86 g/ccColor: Silvery
